hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Regime Transition Momentum
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC transitions from a low-volatility regime (20-day HV < 40%) to a medium-volatility regime (40% ≤ 20-day HV < 80%) within a NEUTRAL price regime, a long volatility position (via ATM straddle) will generate positive alpha over the subsequent 5 trading days, as the initial volatility expansion tends to persist before mean-reverting.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility regime transitions often exhibit momentum. A move from low to medium volatility typically reflects increasing market uncertainty and positioning changes, which are not immediately resolved. The NEUTRAL price filter avoids chasing volatility in strong directional trends where gamma scalping may dominate.
entry_conditions: BTC 20-day Historical Volatility (HV) crosses above 40% from below
BTC price is within +/- 10% of its 50-day moving average (NEUTRAL regime filter)
VIX term structure (VIX3M/VIX) is < 1.15 (no extreme front-end contango)
Entry on next daily close after all conditions met

exit_conditions.take_profit: Position held for 5 trading days OR 20-day HV crosses above 80% (entering high-vol regime)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 20-day HV falls back below 35% (failed regime transition)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Median 5-day return of ATM straddle after entry is ≤ 0 or underperforms a delta-hedged short volatility position by >2%.
